author: Brandon Bigham
comment: Nice job yet again, the app itself works flawless, no bugs or glitches or anything. The only couple things i don't like about it is that when you buy the 3x3, you have to pay to get rid of the adds all together. I think you should make a button that says: buy 3x3+remove adds, for a discount off of the total price. Like from $2.00 to $1.50. Also it only has the 2x2 and 3x3, try adding the 1x1 and the 4x4. Its too bad you can only see one side at a time. You should also add a option so people can make their own logo's and put it on their cube. You should add a few more puzzles too, like the void cube. Just a few pointers. :3

author: lukas sotelo

author: Jeremy Farrell
comment: I love watching your solve videos and things but this is one step further. I love that you can use this app on your watch and your phone. You did a great job and I would love to see some more updates
title: Great game for great puzzle

author: Sam Torbert
comment: Let's be honest, there is no really good way to do a virtual Rubik's cube on any platform.  You will always run into issues trying to display and control a three dimensional moving cube on a two dimensional screen.  This gets even harder when trying to do it on a screen as small as a smart watch.  Kenneth did a great job with what he had.  I do think however due to the presentation of the cube that is app is for pros only, and only worth it if you have a watch
title: For pros only

comment: but it's still not good lol. it's a real pain to solve on such a tiny tiny screen. I've done it 5 times, though. so it can't be THAT bad
title: I mean, probably as good as it could be.

title: Little suggestion

title: Eh.

author: Andrew Austin
comment: The app is a nice change on cubing. The controls take some getting used to but are pretty good once you've figured it out.
title: Great app

author: Stuart Clark
comment: Terrible.  You're limited to viewing one face of the cube at a time, so a) your solves will be riddled with cube rotations and b) you can't do F or B moves at all. To turn the layers you have to gesture on a very specific part of the cube, otherwise it'll either rotate the entire cube, or it won't do anything at all. And vice versa for doing cube rotations, 70% of the time I found myself turning layers when I wanted to rotate the entire cube.  The app is locked to only the 2x2 cube, and you have to pay just over a dollar to be able to use the 3x3 cube. No other size options are available. I bought the 3x3 unlock to see what it does, and was surprised to find that this didn't remove ads. You also have to spend an extra dollar to remove the ads. Really?  Scrambles aren't random state, and must be limited to a certain number of moves or something because all optimal solutions for my 3x3 scrambles were over 18 moves HTM, which means that more than a quarter of all possible scrambles won't be generated at all. The timer only starts when a move is made on the cube, not a rotation, so you have unlimited inspection time, so generating an optimal solution for every state is possible.

reply.author: Kenneth Brandon
reply.content: Thanks for the thorough review Stuart.  Sorry to disappoint.

comment: I enjoy the achievements and the competitive aspect. The fact that there is only one side visible at a time gives it a bit of a small challenge. But if you are in it to practice actual serious solving get a different app.

title: Cool

author: Gorgi Kalamernikov
comment: App works great, haven't encountered bugs with it. It's a challenge only being able to see 1 side of the cube at a time, and that is a good thing. Controls are intuitive although they might need some fine tuning, like middle slice and full cube rotations are a bit dodgy.  The on-screen ads are not annoying for me, no popup ads spotted. Totally worth my 99 cents. Few complaints to be made, but no big ones, these are some annoying bits of the app;   I wish the cubes would be displayed bigger on my android phone, using the entire width of my screen; The back button while on the menu should bring me back to the cube instead of closing the app; On the results screen, redundant moves (like [x' x x] or [x x x]) should be replaced with their shortest form, so it is easier to review the solution.  Got a suggestion or two for improving it, these are little gimmicky things that aren't necessary but would make the app better in my opinion; Sound, i want to be able to hear those distinctive sounds, and a bluetooth/wifi race mode, where all connected devices are given the same scramble, and inspection time is not ignored.
